]>This XML was provided by Springer Naturedoi:10.1023/B:TMCH.0000027443.53384.c031aa4ebcea41b6792ab66adebe5119a0/kaist-api11101

11243Transition Metal ChemistryTransition Metal Chemistry0340-42851572-901XKluwer Academic PublishersDordrechtArt3525572510.1023/B:TMCH.0000027443.53384.c0ArticleSynthesis, Crystal Structure and Magnetism of A 1-D Polymeric Manganese(II) Complex with 2-Hydroxyl-2-Hydroxylate-Malonate as Bridging LigandShiJing-Min1ZhuSi-Cheng1LiuWei-Dong2grid.410585.dDepartment of ChemistryShandong Normal University250014JinanPR Chinagrid.453534.00000000122192654Department of ChemistryZhejiang Normal University321004JinhuaPR China5200429435836012102004© Kluwer Academic Publishers 20042004Abstract

A one-dimensional chain complex {Na[MnL(H2O)2]}n(L = 2-hydroxyl-2-hydroxylate-malonate trivalent anion) has been synthesized and its crystal structure determined by X-ray crystallography. In the complex each Mn ion is located in a distorted octahedral environment with two oxygen atoms O(7) and O(8) from terminal ligands of two H2O molecules, and four other coordinating oxygen atoms O(1), O(5), O(3A) and O(6A) from two bridging ligands, respectively. Each bridging ligand provides four coordinating oxygen atoms, in which O(6) comes from the hydroxylate, O(5) from the hydroxyl, and O(1) and O(3) from two carboxylate groups, respectively. The O(1) and O(5) atoms coordinate to one Mn ion and the O(3) and O(6) atoms coordinate to another Mn ion; a one-dimensional chain is thereby constructed. The variable-temperature magnetic susceptibility of the complex was measured in the 4–300 K range. The magnetic coupling parameter is consistent with an antiferromagnetic exchange and generates the antiferromagnetic coupling parameter, 2J=−0.0544 cm−1.

elements.content: A one-dimensional chain complex {Na[MnL(H2O)2]}n(L = 2-hydroxyl-2-hydroxylate-malonate trivalent anion) has been synthesized and its crystal structure determined by X-ray crystallography. In the complex each Mn ion is located in a distorted octahedral environment with two oxygen atoms O(7) and O(8) from terminal ligands of two H2O molecules, and four other coordinating oxygen atoms O(1), O(5), O(3A) and O(6A) from two bridging ligands, respectively. Each bridging ligand provides four coordinating oxygen atoms, in which O(6) comes from the hydroxylate, O(5) from the hydroxyl, and O(1) and O(3) from two carboxylate groups, respectively. The O(1) and O(5) atoms coordinate to one Mn ion and the O(3) and O(6) atoms coordinate to another Mn ion; a one-dimensional chain is thereby constructed. The variable-temperature magnetic susceptibility of the complex was measured in the 4–300 K range. The magnetic coupling parameter is consistent with an antiferromagnetic exchange and generates the antiferromagnetic coupling parameter, 2J=−0.0544 cm−1.

Abstract

A one-dimensional chain complex {Na[MnL(H2O)2]}n(L = 2-hydroxyl-2-hydroxylate-malonate trivalent anion) has been synthesized and its crystal structure determined by X-ray crystallography. In the complex each Mn ion is located in a distorted octahedral environment with two oxygen atoms O(7) and O(8) from terminal ligands of two H2O molecules, and four other coordinating oxygen atoms O(1), O(5), O(3A) and O(6A) from two bridging ligands, respectively. Each bridging ligand provides four coordinating oxygen atoms, in which O(6) comes from the hydroxylate, O(5) from the hydroxyl, and O(1) and O(3) from two carboxylate groups, respectively. The O(1) and O(5) atoms coordinate to one Mn ion and the O(3) and O(6) atoms coordinate to another Mn ion; a one-dimensional chain is thereby constructed. The variable-temperature magnetic susceptibility of the complex was measured in the 4-300 K range. The magnetic coupling parameter is consistent with an antiferromagnetic exchange and generates the antiferromagnetic coupling parameter, 2J=-0.0544 cm-1.

11243Transition Metal ChemistryTransition Metal Chemistry0340-42851572-901XKluwer Academic PublishersDordrechtArt3525572510.1023/B:TMCH.0000027443.53384.c0ArticleSynthesis, Crystal Structure and Magnetism of A 1-D Polymeric Manganese(II) Complex with 2-Hydroxyl-2-Hydroxylate-Malonate as Bridging LigandShiJing-Min1ZhuSi-Cheng1LiuWei-Dong2grid.410585.dDepartment of ChemistryShandong Normal University250014JinanPR Chinagrid.453534.00000000122192654Department of ChemistryZhejiang Normal University321004JinhuaPR China5200429435836012102004© Kluwer Academic Publishers 20042004Abstract

A one-dimensional chain complex {Na[MnL(H2O)2]}n(L = 2-hydroxyl-2-hydroxylate-malonate trivalent anion) has been synthesized and its crystal structure determined by X-ray crystallography. In the complex each Mn ion is located in a distorted octahedral environment with two oxygen atoms O(7) and O(8) from terminal ligands of two H2O molecules, and four other coordinating oxygen atoms O(1), O(5), O(3A) and O(6A) from two bridging ligands, respectively. Each bridging ligand provides four coordinating oxygen atoms, in which O(6) comes from the hydroxylate, O(5) from the hydroxyl, and O(1) and O(3) from two carboxylate groups, respectively. The O(1) and O(5) atoms coordinate to one Mn ion and the O(3) and O(6) atoms coordinate to another Mn ion; a one-dimensional chain is thereby constructed. The variable-temperature magnetic susceptibility of the complex was measured in the 4–300 K range. The magnetic coupling parameter is consistent with an antiferromagnetic exchange and generates the antiferromagnetic coupling parameter, 2J=−0.0544 cm−1.

Abstract

A one-dimensional chain complex {Na[MnL(H2O)2]}n(L = 2-hydroxyl-2-hydroxylate-malonate trivalent anion) has been synthesized and its crystal structure determined by X-ray crystallography. In the complex each Mn ion is located in a distorted octahedral environment with two oxygen atoms O(7) and O(8) from terminal ligands of two H2O molecules, and four other coordinating oxygen atoms O(1), O(5), O(3A) and O(6A) from two bridging ligands, respectively. Each bridging ligand provides four coordinating oxygen atoms, in which O(6) comes from the hydroxylate, O(5) from the hydroxyl, and O(1) and O(3) from two carboxylate groups, respectively. The O(1) and O(5) atoms coordinate to one Mn ion and the O(3) and O(6) atoms coordinate to another Mn ion; a one-dimensional chain is thereby constructed. The variable-temperature magnetic susceptibility of the complex was measured in the 4–300 K range. The magnetic coupling parameter is consistent with an antiferromagnetic exchange and generates the antiferromagnetic coupling parameter, 2J=−0.0544 cm−1.
